channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: TMC - Defects - Covers, Gratings & Frames problem, 18th August
item.description:
Rocking gully lid in chamber frame lift and inspect - 28 days - Stop & Go (Broken Chamber Cover/Frame)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 18th August
item.description:
Snapped of branch in middle maple tree - At end of June, in the high winds, I reported a branch had snapped off one of the large plane trees. Middle one of the 3. I think the branch was held up by the lower canopy. That branch is now dead or dying and probably needs to be removed to avoid falling into road. On image if you pan up from the lady you can see the scar on the upper branch. The second image shows the dead branch still suspended.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Green or amber traffic light is not working problem, 18th August
item.description:
Customer reporting that the pole appeared to have been hit by a vehicle maybe ~10 days ago, and has been leaning at an increasing angle over that past week.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 18th August
item.description:
There is a crack and damage to a hanging branch which could cause damage to vehicles or walking/cycling passers-by if we get any high winds . My aging parents are very concerned that this might happen.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TMC - Defects - Vegetation problem, 18th August
item.description:
Cut back approx. 20m of hedges - 28 days - Standard TM (Overgrown Hedge)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 18th August
item.description:
Customer reports that roots from the tree at the location are blocking drains (these have recently been identified by STW). Furthermore, the driveway of number 1 is being affected. Please can Highways investigate/remove the tree.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: TMC - Defects - Other FW6 Surface problem, 18th August
item.description:
28 day with give and take plus temporary footway closure footway abrupt level difference due to tree roots 800x400x30mm tarmac patch required stats required. No vehicular access to this section. (FW6 Abrupt Level Differences)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rough Sleeping & Stolen Goods, 18th August
item.description:
This area is attracting rough sleepers and town centre shop lifters. It is adjacent to the entrance to the tower in a HERITAGE SITE used by bell ringers. The Minster Churchyard is once again becoming an ASBO site with alcoholics and drug takers occupying this side of the churchyard.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Well Walk, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sign obstructs view of on coming traffic GL53 0QJ, 18th August
item.description:
Lay by at St Peter's church, gated sign dangerously situated as blocks view of on coming traffic. Isn't even boundary for Leckhampton. Post nearest rd needs moving back towards hedgerow so driver leaving lay by can see what is coming. Lot of speeding cars/vans on this stretch of road & have been trying to get something done since Oct 2023 - please help!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Post or sign leaning slightly (less than 20 degrees)
